column3: Seems like a sane thing to do. utACK.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4929_490c1c084ba04d1e4228d225dcd980e76ed03221/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te

1) The stated logic makes no sense.  They immediately receive a reject message indicating an upgrade is needed.\n2) `MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION` is for ancient nodes we simply refuse to talk to.  Adding code for a test that will in practice never be executed is a waste.\n
Right, we already send a reject before disconnecting, I forgot about that.\n

> "They immediately receive a reject message indicating an upgrade is needed."

Eh?  The reject messages were not part of the protocol until 0.9.
If a node has $this commit, then you also have a bitcoind that sends reject messages.\n
My point is older clients don't actually do anything with the reject message.\n
Older clients do not do anything with the alert message either.\n

Is this patch actually harmful?  No.

I'd like to also submit a patch to allow the user to configure MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION.  Doing so lets you opt-out of talking to old, broken clients which in my experience cuts log spam.
@wtogami It's just that you have a misunderstanding what MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION is for. I've already explained that to you on IRC.\n
No need for this extra level of indentation / braces\n
